column4: is it possible to get a cut down image that will bootstrap the dapper install from a usb keyring?
I did that. used the netinstall image
Im not sure of the brand, its a small SBC, p2 equiv
the dapper kernel is not suitable for embedded devices I think
and also a notebook drive in it
that kernel has EVERY possible option turned on. you don't want that in a tiny system
dapper is not the best choice for embedded linux
Im not developing a platform for anything serious, I have picked up this machine and I want to turn it into a fileserver for home
arm processor, x86 emulation, p2 equiv, 256 ram, 40gig notebook drive
forget about ubuntu and look for distro for embedded devices
I don't think dapper will even work on that
